meanings.definition: A sound made by a clock or watch, typically indicating the passing of time.
meanings.sent1: The ticktock of the clock helped me fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the gentle ticktock of the watch on his wrist.
meanings.sent3: The ticktock of the clock seemed to be whispering secrets.
meanings.sent4: The constant ticktock of the clock echoed through the room like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic ticktock of the watch was a comforting presence.

meanings.definition: To make a ticking or clicking sound, as a clock.
meanings.sent1: I could hear the old clock ticktock in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The clock would ticktock loudly in the silence of the night.
meanings.sent3: The clock seemed to ticktock faster when I was nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her heels ticktocked on the wooden floor as she walked away.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the clock ticktocking was a constant reminder of time passing.

meanings.definition: To mark or count the passage of time with a ticking sound.
meanings.sent1: I like to ticktock the seconds away on my watch.
meanings.sent2: The metronome ticktocks helped me keep pace while playing the piano.
meanings.sent3: The old clock would ticktock the hours away in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the train wheels ticktocking on the tracks was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum of the grandfather clock would ticktock with precision.
